resource-aws-ec2-client-vpn-network-asso:
Resource: aws_ec2_client_vpn_network_association

Provides network associations for AWS Client VPN endpoints. For more information on usage, please see the
AWS Client VPN Administrator's Guide.
example-usage:
Example Usage

terraformresource "aws_ec2_client_vpn_network_association" "example" { client_vpn_endpoint_id = aws_ec2_client_vpn_endpoint.example.id subnet_id = aws_subnet.example.id}
argument-reference:
Argument Reference

This resource supports the following arguments:

  • client_vpn_endpoint_id - (Required) The ID of the Client VPN endpoint.
  • subnet_id - (Required) The ID of the subnet to associate with the Client VPN endpoint.
attribute-reference:
Attribute Reference

This resource exports the following attributes in addition to the arguments above:

  • id - The unique ID of the target network association.
  • association_id - The unique ID of the target network association.
  • vpc_id - The ID of the VPC in which the target subnet is located.
import:
Import

In Terraform v1.5.0 and later, use an import block to import AWS Client VPN network associations using the endpoint ID and the association ID. Values are separated by a ,. For example:

terraformimport { to = aws_ec2_client_vpn_network_association.example id = "cvpn-endpoint-0ac3a1abbccddd666,vpn-assoc-0b8db902465d069ad"}

Using terraform import, import AWS Client VPN network associations using the endpoint ID and the association ID. Values are separated by a ,. For example:

console% terraform import aws_ec2_client_vpn_network_association.example cvpn-endpoint-0ac3a1abbccddd666,vpn-assoc-0b8db902465d069ad
description:
Resource: aws_ec2_client_vpn_network_association

Provides network associations for AWS Client VPN endpoints. For more information on usage, please see the
